Description.0: Portfolio: A portfolio containing the full range of work done by the student is submitted at the end of semester
Description.3: Assignment: 3. Choose a reading in Week 6 of this architectural history SURVEY module from a set of core readings; make a summary of that reading in a provided template and upload the summary by 12 Nov 2022
Description.4: Assignment: 4. Academic Integrity Exercise designed by UCD Library /Writing Centre around plagiarism and referencing. This is like a class test but carried out on Brightspace by 26th Nov 2022
Description.5: Assignment: 1. Choose a reading in Week 1 of this architectural history SURVEY module from a set of core readings; make a summary of that reading in a provided template and upload the summary by 8 Oct 2022
Description.6: Examination: 5. End of module exam for which you will prepare 2 longer questions and answer a 3rd question on referencing.
Description.7: Essay: 2. Observation writing: Write a short essay which pays close attention to a chosen site in Dublin. Visit + sketch, observe + photograph the site, write a 500-word observational essay, by 29 Oct 2022
Description.8: Assignment: Peer review of Learning Journal
Description.11: Portfolio: A portfolio containing the full range of work done by the student is submitted at the end of the semester, to which a letter grade is allocated by the Studio Staff & ratified by the School & Externs.
Description.13: Portfolio: A portfolio is submitted at the end of the semester. The portfolio will contain all work completed, e.g. technology drawings, models, photographs of completed models, sketches and rough work.
Description.14: Essay: Peer Assessment. The student will be asked to review and give feedback to their Peer's work using peerScholar through Brightspace.
Description.15: Examination: Assignment 4 = Exam. The exam consists of 2 prepared long questions and 1 shorter unseen question.
Description.16: Assignment: Assignment 1 = Reading summaryChoice of architectural writing to be read and summarised by week 2.
Description.17: Assignment: Assignment 3 = media reviewVisit an exhibition or listen to a podcast and write a review for week 10.
Description.18: Assignment: Assignment 2 = Building Research and Writing Exercise. In partnership with Drawing + Making and Studio modules, this is a research and writing exercise which is due in week 7.
Description.19: Group Project: Distributions of Forces in Structures
Description.21: Group Project: How Structures Stand Up
Description.22: Group Project: Materials and their Properties
Description.27: Portfolio: Collated assignments done over the semester brought together as a single document formatted to be graphically coherent
Description.29: Portfolio: A Portfolio containing the full range of work done by the student is submitted at the end of the semester.A letter grade is allocated by the Studio Staff & ratified by the School and Externs.
Description.31: Studio Examination: Technology StudioSubmission most likely in week 7
Description.35: Assignment: Preliminary work-in-progress submission for Project 2 (scripting files and 1-page summary document)
Description.36: Portfolio: Portfolio 1 (Rhino): Work on Project 1 assembled into a portfolio document plus digital submission of project Rhino files
Description.37: Portfolio: Portfolio 2 (Grasshopper): Work on Project 2 assembled into a portfolio document plus digital submission of project Grasshopper/Rhino files
Description.38: Portfolio: Design and Technology project work
Description.39: Essay: 2000 word illustrated and fully-referenced essay on a villa landscape selected by the student.
Description.40: Examination: An end-of-semester exam providing a choice of questions drawn from all sections of the course. The student will have to answer 3 questions.
Description.45: Project: Design project of four weeks duration, detailed submission requirements are set out in the programme document.
Description.47: Essay: Draft Project essay - The student will be asked to review and give feed-back to their peer's work using peerScholar through Brightspace.
Description.48: Essay: Project essay - This exercise will examine in detail the perception and awareness of building construction methods and performance.
Description.52: Essay: 600 words essay on Reflective Practice
Description.53: Essay: 600 words essay on Urban Design Theory
